intro: Coccoloba lucidula, commonly known as the glossy coccoloba, is a tropical flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves with a smooth, glossy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and wetlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and used in landscape design.
